Lists Demonstration

Simple Bullet List

•	First bullet point

•	Second bullet point

•	Third bullet point

•	Fourth bullet point

Multi-level Bullet List

•	Main topic one

○	Subtopic 1.1

○	Subtopic 1.2

▪	Sub-subtopic 1.2.1

▪	Sub-subtopic 1.2.2

•	Main topic two

○	Subtopic 2.1

Simple Numbered List (Decimal)

1.	First numbered item

2.	Second numbered item

3.	Third numbered item

4.	Fourth numbered item

Multi-level Numbered List (6 Levels Deep)

5.	Level 1 - Main section (1.)

1.%2.	Level 2 - Subsection (1.1.)

1.%2.%3.	Level 3 - Sub-subsection (1.1.1.)

1.%2.%3.%4.	Level 4 - Detailed point (1.1.1.1.)

1.%2.%3.%4.%5.	Level 5 - Fine detail (1.1.1.1.1.)

1.%2.%3.%4.%5.%6.	Level 6 - Finest detail (1.1.1.1.1.1.)

2.%2.%3.%4.%5.	Level 5 - Another fine detail (1.1.1.1.2.)

2.%2.%3.%4.	Level 4 - Another detailed point (1.1.1.2.)

2.%2.%3.	Level 3 - Another sub-subsection (1.1.2.)

2.%2.	Level 2 - Another subsection (1.2.)

6.	Level 1 - Second main section (2.)

3.%2.	Level 2 - Its subsection (2.1.)

3.%2.%3.	Level 3 - Its sub-subsection (2.1.1.)

7.	Level 1 - Third main section (3.)

Roman Numerals List (6 Levels Deep)

Alternating upper and lower case Roman numerals at each level:

I.	Level 1 - Upper Roman (I.)

i%2.	Level 2 - Lower Roman (i.)

I%3.	Level 3 - Upper Roman (I.)

i%4.	Level 4 - Lower Roman (i.)

I%5.	Level 5 - Upper Roman (I.)

i%6.	Level 6 - Lower Roman (i.)

ii%6.	Level 6 - Lower Roman (ii.)

II%5.	Level 5 - Upper Roman (II.)

ii%4.	Level 4 - Lower Roman (ii.)

II%3.	Level 3 - Upper Roman (II.)

ii%2.	Level 2 - Lower Roman (ii.)

II.	Level 1 - Upper Roman (II.)

iii%2.	Level 2 - Lower Roman (i.)

III.	Level 1 - Upper Roman (III.)

IV.	Level 1 - Upper Roman (IV.)

Letter-based List (6 Levels Deep)

Alternating upper and lower case letters at each level:

A.	Level 1 - Upper case letter (A.)

a%2.	Level 2 - Lower case letter (a.)

A%3.	Level 3 - Upper case letter (A.)

a%4.	Level 4 - Lower case letter (a.)

A%5.	Level 5 - Upper case letter (A.)

a%6.	Level 6 - Lower case letter (a.)

b%6.	Level 6 - Lower case letter (b.)

c%6.	Level 6 - Lower case letter (c.)

B%5.	Level 5 - Upper case letter (B.)

d%6.	Level 6 - Lower case letter (a.)

b%4.	Level 4 - Lower case letter (b.)

B%3.	Level 3 - Upper case letter (B.)

b%2.	Level 2 - Lower case letter (b.)

B.	Level 1 - Upper case letter (B.)

c%2.	Level 2 - Lower case letter (a.)

C.	Level 1 - Upper case letter (C.)

Key Points About Lists

•	Each numbering reference creates an independent list

•	Same reference continues numbering, different reference restarts

•	Levels create hierarchical structure (0 = main, 1 = sub, 2 = sub-sub)

•	Indentation is controlled by left and hanging indent values

•	Always use LevelFormat constants (BULLET, DECIMAL, UPPER_ROMAN, LOWER_LETTER, etc.)
